title: Infinite bootloop
content:
My 2016 Google Pixel crashed a day ago, while using it, and now stuck in an infinite boot loop. This problem has been described a thousand times before, but I found something unusual, not mentioned before.
While in bootloop, I hold down volume down button alone, and it enters the bootloader menu, without touching the power button.
Aside from that it really doesn't look like a stuck power button. When the phone is off, this one button trick doesn't work, Recovery mode doesn't work either, choosing any option takes it back into the bootloop, however I can switch it off with power off option, and then it stays off for any amount of time.
Being in Eastern-Europe, we have no authorized dealers and repair shops for google devices. Does this mean I have to dump my phone? Or is there a way to repair it?
